DOC.brief_summary: The objective protocol compare degree improvement achieve patient shoulder pain treatment Manipulative Techniques cervicothoracic spine versus home exercise .
DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness Cervicothoracic Manipulative Treatment Unilateral Shoulder Impingement Syndrome : A Randomized Controlled Trial .
DOC.detailed_description: Design : Randomized Clinical Trial . Objective : determine effect manipulative technique ervicothoracic spine versus home exercise pain , disability , range movement patient unilateral shoulder inmingement syndrome . Methods Measures : ninety-two subject randomly assign one two group . Intervention : For 5-weeks , group 1 undergo tratment comprise manipulative protocol technique cervicothoracic spine ( 2/week ) group 2 develop home exercise ( 2/week ) . Main Outcome Measures : Intensity pain , disability , range motion data collect baseline , 24hr last therapy application . Mixed-model analysis variance use examine effect treatment outcome measure .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Report pain dysfunction overhead activity 2 . Demonstration pain active shoulder movement 3 . Demonstration positive Neer/HawkinsKennedy test 4 . Recent onset within last 12 month 5 . Report nontraumatic onset 6 . Demonstration painful arc arm 60° 120° flexion 7 . Report baseline pain level ≥2/10 11 point numeric scale The presence red flag A history frozen shoulder Disorders acromioclavicular joint Degenerative arthritis glenohumeral joint Known calcifying tendonitis ( identify radiograph ) Shoulder instability Posttraumatic disorder Shoulder surgery and/or elbow , hand , wrist blatantly misdiagnosed cervical spine disorder
